greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of polyominoes without holes consisting of 3 regular unit n-gons.
comment: Conjecture: if n > 3, then a(n + 3) is the number of connected components of the subgraph that is vertex-induced on Collatz's graph by the vertex subset {1, ..., n} (see Problem 3.11 of my article, available from the links). - _Lorenzo Sauras Altuzarra_, Apr 07 2020 [Corrected by _Pontus von Brömssen_, Jan 22 2021]
link: Colin Barker, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..1000
M. Koch and S. Kurz, Enumeration of generalized polyominoes, arXiv:math/0605144 [math.CO], 2006.
Lorenzo Sauras Altuzarra, Some arithmetical problems that are obtained by analyzing proofs and infinite graphs, arXiv:2002.03075 [math.NT], 2020.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,0,0,0,1,-1).
example: a(3)=1 because there is only one polyiamond consisting of 3 triangles and a(4)=2 because there are 2 polyominoes consisting of 3 squares.
results.author: _Sascha Kurz_, Feb 07 2005
